rank 2 is the required rank now. the emperor woke up or something.

rank 2 is the required rank now. the emperor woke up or something.

Truth is I'm not sure how to rank up at all, I couldn't find any missions that seemed to be Imperial military so I just kept doing mission for anyone with Empire in their name but really wasn't making any progress after dozens of missions.

I swear the makers of this game don't want people to make any progress, to get any progress at all seems like it needs hundreds of hours investment and the game is 90% just sat there watching your ship trundle through space.

I just can't understand how Elite 2 twenty years ago was a really fun game and this one is nowhere near as good.

It's not just the lack of planetary landings, there are lots of reasons.

For example in elite 2 you can see a proper solar system view (with orbits) of any system from anywhere else and then target the planet or space station you want to get to, jump into the system and fly there in seconds using the autopilot.

Another thing is the awful external camera they finally put in, begrudgingly it seems as the only way to control it is with the same gamepad controls used to fly the ship.

every time I try to get a look at my ship flying past a station or star I fail because by the time I've got the camera in the right position the object I wanted to look at is half a light year behind me.

Why won't they let me use the mouse to move the camera?

and nothing says "We don't want you to use this feature" more than a debug message when you activate the external camera.

frankly if they don't add in an autopilot that let's me get where I want to go in seconds and fix the external camera, I just can't be bothered

there are so many other games that are much more fun to play that I don't see the point in investing the time required to make any progress.

Edited August 3, 2015 by MartGonzo

Hmm, what did I do today?

I went on a nice little vacation to visit the solar system that had three black holes, and all sorts of crazy ..... Took screen shots and slapped some awesome captions - I felt like I was visiting some kind of spatial Grand Canyon.

I trafficked a few trade contracts to have the minimum of 100 required to keep my rank2 in the Alliance (Powerplay).. no time at the moment to do anything useful.

I have a nicely upgraded light weight cobra with a class A fuel scoop and advanced scanners. proper rig for exploration with an empty 12LY jumps capablity. or if required 16t cargo and still good enough for combating ASP's and alike with gymballed burst lasers, a gatling and a big canon to scare away the big badguys.

It's a good game if you consider it alpha state, however I am more looking forward to Star Citizen. All I need is a rig that can run the CRY engine..

back to Elite. I like the idea of powerplay, but it seriously lacks a social aspect. for example in WOW there where massive cities where people would just hang around and and browse auctions in the market. Then spend gold to buy fancy suits just to show off.

I would like to see something like that in the future of Elite. Walking around with my personal flight suit. big gun over my shoulder and a pet-R2D2 following me around.
also some guy is going to eat a sock. so someone is going to edit that video to have all the socks in it.
